poem:
Unidentified Anomaly

In the morning's quiet rise,  
silver whispers spread   
across skies like gossip.  
Hold still, let the ordinary  
surrender to the unseen—  
a flicker of wonder,  
unclaimed shadows,  
truth wrapped in clouds,  
teasing our grounded eyes.  
Explain away, yet leave us  
beneath uncommon stars  
calling for vision.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UFOs have earned a new name – and should be objects of serious study | Letters Much as in the US, with the recent congressional hearings on unidentified anomalous phenomena, the UK government is apparently less than transparent in its handling of UAP sightings (formerly called UFOs) – as your article about the Calvine photo shows (What really happened in Calvine? The mystery behind the best UFO picture ever seen, G2, 11 February). And, as". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
